title: Completed PE Summary - RMS Mulheim
raw_html:
Category Merchant
Registered Owner & Manager: BWK Schiffinvest Gmbh & Co KG m.s
Port of registry: Antigua & Barbuda
Flag: Antigua & Barbuda
Type: Dry cargo
Built: 1999
Classification society: Bureau Veritas
Construction: 89.74
Length overall: 89.74
Gross tonnage: 1846.00
Date & Time 22/03/03 04:55
Location of incident: English coastal waters
Incident Type: Grounding
Persons onboard: 6 crew
Injuries/ fatalities: None
Damage/ Pollution: Constructive loss

Synopsis

Small coastal vessel grounded near Lands End after the sole watch keeper became incapacitated by a fall from the bridge chair.The ship became a constructive total loss and the cargo of scrap plastic was discharged at the wreck site.

Action taken:

The Chief Inspector of Marine Accidents has written to the owner of the vessel noting the post-accident, corrective actions taken by the company, especially with respect to observing the flag states' circular concerning lookouts being posted with the officer of the watch during the hours of darkness and that the watch alarm should be switched on whenever the officer is the sole lookout.

Flag: |   | Antigua & Barbuda |

Built: |   | 1999 | 
Classification society: |   | Bureau Veritas | 
Construction: |   | 89.74 | 
Length overall: |   | 89.74 | 
Gross tonnage: |   | 1846.00 | 
Date & Time |   | 22/03/03 04:55 | 
Location of incident: |   | English coastal waters | 
Incident Type: |   | Grounding | 
Persons onboard: |   | 6 crew | 
Injuries/ fatalities: |   | None | 
Damage/ Pollution: |   | Constructive loss | 

Synopsis

Small coastal vessel grounded near Lands End after the sole watch keeper became incapacitated by a fall from the bridge chair.The ship became a constructive total loss and the cargo of scrap plastic was discharged at the wreck site. 

Action taken:

The Chief Inspector of Marine Accidents has written to the owner of the vessel noting the post-accident, corrective actions taken by the company, especially with respect to observing the flag states' circular concerning lookouts being posted with the officer of the watch during the hours of darkness and that the watch alarm should be switched on whenever the officer is the sole lookout.
